messages.message: I noticed the issue with the bounding box jitter reappearing in the safety-analysis module under high-density scenarios. I’ve reopened Jira ticket SAFETY-223.
Thanks for catching that, Arjun. Was it tied to specific hardware setups or software configurations?
Mostly on older Jetson Nano devices during simultaneous inference tasks.
I’ve seen similar behavior in the face-recognition-airports module when processing partially occluded faces. Could it be related?
Possibly. I’ll cross-check the alignment between these two modules and see if there’s a shared dependency.
I’ve updated the Confluence page with details on the fallback issue in person detection during thermal imaging tests: https://confluence.nvidia.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=911233.
Thanks, Maria. I’ll check if those fallback edge cases are also triggering the jitter issue.
The automated deployment script for bug fixes in the face-recognition-airports project failed last night. I’ve logged this as BUG-324.
I’ll rerun the script with additional logging to see where it’s failing.
Could it be related to the recent update in the Jenkins pipeline for the airports module?
Potentially. I’ll verify the configurations and report back.
The person-detection-autonomous-vehicles module is showing inconsistent latency during fog simulations. I’ve flagged this in Jira as BUG-407.
Noted. I’ll rerun those simulations and profile the preprocessing pipeline to isolate the bottleneck.
The GitHub repo for the deepfake-detection project is missing the latest dependency updates. I’ll push a patch shortly.
Thanks, Michael. Let’s ensure the CI/CD pipeline triggers validation checks after the patch.
The anomaly-detection script for the safety-analysis module is crashing when handling dense data streams. I’ve logged it as BUG-431.
Could be a memory allocation issue. I’ll monitor the runtime metrics and report back.
I’ve updated the QA tracker with edge cases where person detection fails under overlapping shadows. QA results are available here: https://notion.nvidia.com/qa-results-tracker.
Thanks, Maria. I’ll use these cases to test the latest preprocessing updates.
I noticed a recurring issue with the deepfake-detection dashboard not updating in real-time. I’ll debug the front-end rendering scripts.
The latest bug fixes in the airports module have improved latency by 12%. Let’s validate this in the next stakeholder demo.
